column4: ''You likely do not want to install this package directly. Instead, install the linux-backports-modules-wireless-generic meta-package, which will ensure that upgrades work correctly, and that supporting packages are also installed. ''
so that's the package i need
now when you boot Ubuntu, double click it, and hopefully it won't have any dependency problems
what is the wireless device that gve you all these problems?
what version of Ubuntu did you install?
ok.. was just making sure you weren't installing 8.10... been a lot of that lately(i guess some book came out w/ that cd)
It stopped at the ''who are you'' screen
well you were past the hard part(partitioning)
i didn't ever have that prob w/ 10.04, but there ws a bug on that w/ 10.04
yes, thats why i asked you what your sond device was
open a terminal and type "lspci"(lowercase L) and hit enter.. .look at the output, and find your sound device
i kno it was an issue w/ the intelHDA sound devices on Ubuntu 10.10(worked perfect for me in 10.04), did some googling, and found the fix, it involved edting some configuration files
